definitions: the act or process of making something lawful that was previously illegal or prohibited
examples: The legalization of marijuana sparked nationwide debate among lawmakers
Many countries are considering the legalization of certain recreational drugs

definitions: traditional story or myth passed down through generations about heroic figures or supernatural events
person who has achieved fame and lasting recognition for extraordinary accomplishments
explanatory list of symbols and their meanings on a map or diagram
examples: Ancient Greek legends tell of heroes battling mythical creatures
The legend of King Arthur continues to captivate modern audiences
Muhammad Ali became a boxing legend through his incredible career
She's already a legend in the fashion industry at age thirty
Check the map legend to understand what each symbol represents
The chart's legend explains the different colored lines and markers

definitions: breed of domestic chicken known for prolific white egg production
fine plaited straw from Italy used in making lightweight hats
examples: White Leghorn chickens are popular on commercial egg farms worldwide
Our backyard flock includes several brown Leghorn hens for eggs
She wore an elegant leghorn hat to the summer garden party
The milliner specialized in crafting delicate leghorn bonnets and sun hats

definitions: the quality or state of being clear enough to read or decipher easily
examples: The doctor's poor handwriting reduced the legibility of the prescription
Font size directly affects the legibility of printed text materials

definitions: ancient Roman military unit consisting of three to six thousand soldiers
vast number or multitude of people or things
veterans' service organization such as the American Legion
examples: Caesar commanded several legions during his conquest of Gaul
The Roman legion was known for its disciplined fighting formations
Her fans are legion across social media platforms worldwide
The problems facing the company are legion and deeply rooted
He joined the local Legion post after retiring from military service
The Legion hall hosts community events every Friday evening

definitions: professional soldier who served as member of a Roman legion
examples: The legionary carried standard equipment weighing over sixty pounds
Roman legionaries built roads and fortifications throughout the empire

definitions: member of a legion, especially the French Foreign Legion or veterans organization
person afflicted with Legionnaires' disease, a severe form of pneumonia
examples: The French Foreign Legion legionnaire completed his five-year service contract
Local legionnaires organized the annual Memorial Day parade
Several legionnaires were hospitalized during the outbreak at the hotel
The legionnaire recovered after intensive antibiotic treatment for the infection

definitions: the act or process of making or enacting laws through legislative procedures
examples: Congress spent months legislating new healthcare reform measures
The difficulty of legislating morality has long been debated

definitions: laws collectively, especially those enacted by a legislative body
the process or act of making or enacting laws
examples: New environmental legislation requires stricter emissions standards for vehicles
The legislation passed by narrow margins after heated debate
The legislation of complex issues often takes years to complete
Effective legislation requires careful consideration of unintended consequences

definitions: person who makes laws, especially member of a legislative body
examples: State legislators voted on the education funding bill yesterday
The legislator introduced three new bills during the session

definitions: organized body of persons having authority to make laws for a political unit
examples: The state legislature convenes twice yearly for regular sessions
Members of the legislature debated the proposed tax reforms

definitions: quality or state of being lawful, legal, or in accordance with established rules
quality of being accepted as valid, justified, or reasonable by relevant standards
examples: The court questioned the legitimacy of the contested will document
The new government struggled to establish its legitimacy after the coup
Scientists debated the legitimacy of the experimental methodology used
The legitimacy of her concerns became apparent during the investigation

definitions: the act or process of making something legitimate, lawful, or officially acceptable
examples: The legitimation of the new policy required approval from multiple departments
Cultural legitimation of social practices often occurs gradually over time

definitions: plant of the pea family that produces seeds in pods and fixes nitrogen in soil
edible seed or pod from leguminous plants used as food
examples: Farmers rotate crops with legumes to restore nitrogen to the soil
Soybeans are an important legume crop grown worldwide
Adding legumes like lentils to your diet provides excellent protein
Dried legumes should be soaked before cooking to reduce cooking time

definitions: traditional Hawaiian garland of flowers worn around the neck
basic monetary unit of Romania
examples: Visitors received beautiful plumeria leis upon arriving in Hawaii
She learned to make traditional leis from her Hawaiian grandmother
The price was listed as fifty lei at the Bucharest market
He exchanged euros for Romanian lei at the airport

definitions: time when one is not working or occupied with duties; time available for relaxation and enjoyment
examples: She enjoys reading novels during her leisure hours each evening
The resort offers many leisure activities for guests to enjoy

definitions: recurring musical theme associated with particular person, place, or idea in a composition
dominant or recurring theme, idea, or pattern in artistic or literary work
examples: Wagner's operas feature distinctive leitmotifs for each major character
The composer used a haunting leitmotif to represent impending doom
Isolation serves as a leitmotif throughout the author's collected works
The leitmotif of redemption appears repeatedly in the film trilogy

definitions: word or phrase defined in dictionary or glossary; the canonical form
subsidiary or intermediate theorem in an argument or proof
examples: Each lemma in the dictionary includes pronunciation and etymology information
The lexicographer carefully selected lemmas for the new edition
We must first prove this lemma before tackling the main theorem
The mathematical lemma simplified the proof considerably

definitions: small arctic rodent with brown fur that undergoes periodic mass migrations
person who unthinkingly follows the crowd, often to harmful consequences
examples: Norwegian lemmings migrate in large numbers during population booms
The documentary captured lemmings crossing the frozen tundra
Don't be a lemming; think critically before following trends
Corporate lemmings rushed to copy the failed business model

definitions: oval yellow citrus fruit with acidic juice used in cooking and beverages
defective or unsatisfactory product, especially an unreliable automobile
pale yellow color resembling that of a lemon fruit
examples: She squeezed fresh lemon juice over the grilled fish
The recipe calls for both lemon zest and juice
That car turned out to be a lemon with constant mechanical problems
The manufacturer recalled thousands of lemons from that production run
She painted the kitchen walls a cheerful lemon yellow
The bridesmaids wore dresses in soft lemon chiffon

definitions: sweet drink made from lemon juice, water, and sugar
examples: Children sold ice-cold lemonade from their sidewalk stand
Nothing beats fresh lemonade on a hot summer afternoon

definitions: nocturnal primate with large eyes and long tail native to Madagascar
examples: Ring-tailed lemurs are the most recognizable species at the zoo
Madagascar's lemur population faces threats from habitat destruction

definitions: person or institution that provides money to borrowers with expectation of repayment
examples: The mortgage lender approved their home loan application yesterday
Private lenders often charge higher interest rates than banks

definitions: the act or business of providing loans or credit to borrowers
examples: Bank lending practices came under scrutiny after the crisis
Predatory lending targets vulnerable borrowers with unfair terms

definitions: measurement or extent of something from end to end; the longest dimension
duration or extent of time that something lasts
full extent or degree of something in detail or scope
examples: The table's length measures exactly six feet from end to end
We need to know the length of fabric required for curtains
The length of the movie exceeded three hours
She was surprised by the length of the application process
He went to great lengths to ensure everyone felt included
The report's length made it difficult to read in one sitting

definitions: the act or process of making something longer in distance, duration, or extent
examples: The lengthening of daylight hours signals the arrival of spring
Runway lengthening will accommodate larger aircraft at the airport

definitions: quality of being merciful or tolerant; mildness in punishing or judging someone
examples: The judge showed leniency due to the defendant's clean record
Parents debated whether leniency or strictness worked better with teenagers

definitions: small flat edible seed from a leguminous plant, rich in protein
examples: Red lentils cook faster than green varieties in soups
She prepared a hearty lentil curry for the vegetarian guests

definitions: large solitary cat with yellowish coat marked with black spots, native to Africa and Asia
examples: The leopard dragged its prey up into the acacia tree
Snow leopards inhabit mountainous regions of Central Asia

definitions: person suffering from leprosy, a chronic infectious disease affecting skin and nerves
person who is shunned or rejected by others in society
examples: Medieval lepers lived in isolated colonies outside town walls
The leper colony provided medical care and community support
After the scandal, he became a social leper at the club
She felt like a leper when coworkers avoided her

definitions: small mischievous fairy in Irish folklore, often depicted as a bearded man
examples: Children searched for the leprechaun's pot of gold at the rainbow's end
The leprechaun in the story granted three wishes to his captor

definitions: chronic infectious disease caused by bacteria affecting skin, nerves, and mucous membranes
examples: Modern antibiotics can effectively cure leprosy if treated early
Historical fear of leprosy led to social isolation of sufferers

definitions: woman who is romantically or sexually attracted to other women
person from or relating to the Greek island of Lesbos
examples: The lesbian couple celebrated their tenth wedding anniversary together
She came out as a lesbian during her college years
The ancient Lesbian poets included the famous Sappho
Lesbian wine was prized in ancient Greek markets

definitions: romantic or sexual attraction between women; the state of being a lesbian
examples: Academic studies of lesbianism emerged in gender studies programs
Historical attitudes toward lesbianism varied across different cultures

definitions: region of damaged tissue in an organ or body part caused by injury or disease
examples: The MRI scan revealed a small lesion on the patient's liver
Skin lesions should be examined by a dermatologist for cancer

definitions: person who holds property under a lease agreement; a tenant
examples: The lessee must pay rent on the first of each month
Commercial lessees often negotiate multi-year lease agreements

definitions: the act or process of becoming smaller, weaker, or less intense
examples: The gradual lessening of pain indicated the medication was working
Environmental groups noted a lessening of pollution in urban areas

definitions: period of instruction or teaching on a particular subject or skill
useful piece of knowledge gained from an experience, especially a difficult one
passage from the Bible read during a religious service
examples: Today's math lesson covers quadratic equations and their applications
She gives private piano lessons every Tuesday afternoon
The failed project taught them valuable lessons about planning
Life's hardest lessons often come from our biggest mistakes
The priest read the lesson from the Book of Isaiah
Today's lesson comes from Paul's letter to the Corinthians

definitions: person who leases or rents property to another; a landlord
examples: The lessor retained the right to inspect the property monthly
Commercial lessors typically require security deposits from tenants

definitions: period for which property is leased or rented to a tenant
tennis serve that must be replayed due to net interference
examples: The summer let of the beach house provides extra income
They secured a long-term let on the commercial property
The umpire called a let when the serve clipped the net
After two lets, she finally got her serve in play

definitions: feeling of disappointment or anticlimax when something fails to meet expectations
examples: The movie sequel was a complete letdown after the original
Graduation day felt like a letdown after years of anticipation

definitions: capacity to cause death; the degree to which something is lethal or deadly
examples: Scientists studied the lethality of various snake venoms
The weapon's increased lethality concerned military ethics experts

definitions: state of sluggishness, inactivity, and lack of energy or enthusiasm
examples: Chronic lethargy may indicate an underlying medical condition
The team's lethargy in the second half cost them the game

definitions: written or printed symbol representing a speech sound in an alphabet
written message addressed to a person or organization
precise terms or literal meaning of a statement or document
examples: The child learned to write the letter A in kindergarten
English has twenty-six letters in its alphabet
She received a letter from her grandmother every month
The CEO sent an open letter to all employees
They followed the letter of the law rather than its spirit
The contract must be executed to the letter

definitions: letters or words that are written, printed, or inscribed on something
the art or process of inscribing letters on a surface
examples: The gold lettering on the book cover had begun to fade
The monument featured carved lettering in classical Roman style
She studied calligraphy and lettering at art school
Professional lettering requires steady hands and artistic skill

definitions: student athlete who has earned a varsity letter in high school or college sports
examples: The letterman proudly wore his varsity jacket to school
She was a three-sport letterman in basketball, track, and volleyball

definitions: the act or business of renting out property to tenants
examples: The letting agency manages properties for absentee landlords
Short-term lettings have become popular through online platforms

definitions: edible plant with large green leaves commonly used in salads
examples: She added crisp romaine lettuce to the Caesar salad
The garden produced several varieties of lettuce this season

definitions: cancer of blood-forming tissues that affects production of white blood cells
examples: The child's leukaemia went into remission after chemotherapy treatment
Advances in treating leukaemia have improved survival rates significantly

definitions: cancer affecting blood and bone marrow, characterized by abnormal white blood cell production
examples: Acute leukemia requires immediate and aggressive treatment protocols
The foundation raises funds for pediatric leukemia research
